title: WorldCraft: Photo-Realistic 3D World Creation and Customization via LLM Agents
author: Xinhang Liu (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Chi-Keung Tang (The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Yu-Wing Tai (Dartmouth College), ... ,
relevance_why: The paper introduces methodologies that leverage machine learning, specifically Large Language Models (LLMs) and procedural generation, which can inform similar approaches in audio and music generation tasks, particularly in creating immersive environments.
background: Developing interactive systems to automatically generate and customize complex 3D virtual scenes based on natural language prompts, enabling non-professionals to materialize their creative visions.
contribution: This paper introduces WorldCraft, a system utilizing Large Language Model (LLM) agents for the procedural generation of realistic 3D worlds, enabling user-driven customization and scene management.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often struggle with visual quality, detail, and object-level control in scene generation.
technical_comparison.novelty: WorldCraft improves on these limitations by allowing detailed natural language interactions and using specialized agents for object customization and layout generation.

key_innovation: The integration of procedural generation coupled with LLMs that support complex user interactions for creating and customizing 3D worlds.
real_world_impact: WorldCraft can democratize 3D world-building, making it accessible to non-professionals and enabling a new wave of creative expression in fields like gaming, film, and virtual reality.
limitations: No limitations were explicitly mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Photo-Realistic: **Photo-realistic** refers to the extent to which a 3D model resembles a real-world object or scene, often requiring sophisticated texturing and rendering techniques.
new_terms.Large Language Model (LLM): **Large Language Model** refers to a type of artificial intelligence model designed to understand and generate human-like text based on vast datasets.
